questions.question: According to the text, what is one of the main concerns about social media's impact on human relationships?
options: It makes communication too expensive
It may undermine our ability to form face-to-face connections
It requires too much technical knowledge
It only works in certain countries
questions.correctAnswer: It may undermine our ability to form face-to-face connections
questions.location: However, critics argue that this constant digital interaction may be undermining our ability to form meaningful, face-to-face connections.

questions.question: What does the term 'echo chambers' refer to in the context of social media?
options: Loud notification sounds from apps
Repeated posting of the same content

questions.correctAnswer: Exposure primarily to information that reinforces existing beliefs
questions.location: Furthermore, the phenomenon of 'echo chambers' – where users are primarily exposed to information and opinions that reinforce their existing beliefs – has contributed to political polarization and the spread of misinformation.

questions.location: Research suggests that excessive social media use can lead to increased feelings of isolation and depression, particularly among young people who have grown up in the digital age.

questions.correctAnswer: It gives voice to those who previously lacked platforms to express their views
questions.location: Despite these challenges, social media has also democratized information sharing and given voice to marginalized communities who previously lacked platforms to express their views.
